description: OpenSSH 7.x may be vulnerable to command injection via scp (CVE-2020-15778)
OpenSSH 6.x is vulnerable to unauthorized agent forwarding (CVE-2016-10009)
OpenSSH 4.x/5.x contains multiple critical vulnerabilities
remediation: Upgrade to OpenSSH 8.x or later immediately

description: Apache 2.4.49/2.4.50 path traversal and RCE vulnerability
Apache 2.4.x (before 2.4.52) buffer overflow in mod_lua
Apache 2.2.x is end-of-life and contains known vulnerabilities
nginx versions before 1.18 contain multiple vulnerabilities including DNS resolver
nginx 1.18.x DNS resolver vulnerability
IIS 5.x-7.x contains critical vulnerabilities including WebDAV RCE
remediation: Upgrade to IIS 10.x on Windows Server 2016+

description: vsftpd 2.3.4 contains a backdoor triggered by a smiley face in the username
remediation: Upgrade to vsftpd 3.x or remove the backdoored version

description: ProFTPD 1.3.5 mod_copy allows unauthenticated arbitrary file copy
ProFTPD 1.3.x (before 1.3.6) arbitrary file copy over site cpfr/cpto
MySQL 5.0-5.5 is end-of-life and no longer receives security patches
remediation: Upgrade to MySQL 8.x or use MariaDB 10.x

description: MySQL 5.6 is end-of-life (Feb 2021)
MySQL 5.7 approaches end-of-life (Oct 2023)
Redis versions before 6.0 may be vulnerable to sandbox escape (CVE-2022-0543)
remediation: Upgrade to Redis 7.x and require authentication

description: Exim 4.87-4.91 remote command execution via local_part ("Return of the WIZard")
Postfix 2.x is outdated and may lack modern security features
Sendmail 8.10-8.14 known information disclosure vulnerability
remediation: Upgrade to latest Sendmail or migrate to Postfix

description: PostgreSQL 9.0-9.4 is end-of-life
PostgreSQL 9.5/9.6 is end-of-life
VNC using RFB 3.3 protocol — weak authentication, no encryption
remediation: Upgrade VNC server and enforce RFB 3.8+ with strong auth

description: RDP service detected — check for BlueKeep (CVE-2019-0708) if Windows 7/2008
remediation: Apply Microsoft security patches, enable NLA, restrict RDP access

description: MongoDB instance detected on network — check for authentication bypass
remediation: Enable authentication, bind to localhost, use TLS

description: Elasticsearch instance exposed — potential Groovy sandbox escape
remediation: Enable X-Pack security, restrict network access, disable dynamic scripting

description: Jetty versions before 9.x contain known vulnerabilities
PHP version detected is end-of-life or contains known vulnerabilities
remediation: Upgrade to PHP 8.1+ or latest supported version

description: Apache Tomcat versions may be vulnerable to Ghostcat (CVE-2020-1938)
lighttpd version is outdated
Dovecot 2.0-2.2 contains known buffer overflow and information leak vulnerabilities
CUPS 1.x end-of-life and may contain heap buffer overflow vulnerabilities
Dropbear SSH older versions may leak usernames
CouchDB may allow privilege escalation via JSON parsing
remediation: Upgrade CouchDB, enable authentication, restrict network access

description: Docker API exposed on network — potential full host compromise
remediation: Never expose Docker API without TLS and client certificate auth
